     862             :    *   recomputing the matrix.

    1057             :   enum class PaintFrameFlags : uint32_t {

    1059             :     PAINT_SYNC_DECODE_IMAGES = 0x02,
    1060             :     PAINT_WIDGET_LAYERS = 0x04,

    1062             :     PAINT_DOCUMENT_RELATIVE = 0x10,
    1063             :     PAINT_HIDE_CARET = 0x20,
    1064             :     PAINT_TO_WINDOW = 0x40,
    1065             :     PAINT_EXISTING_TRANSACTION = 0x80,
    1066             :     PAINT_NO_COMPOSITE = 0x100,
    1067             :     PAINT_COMPRESSED = 0x200

    1069             : 
    1070             :   /**
    1071             :    * Given aFrame, the root frame of a stacking context, paint it and its
    1072             :    * descendants to aRenderingContext.
    1073             :    * @param aRenderingContext a rendering context translated so that (0,0)
    1074             :    * is the origin of aFrame; for best results, (0,0) should transform
    1075             :    * to pixel-aligned coordinates. This can be null, in which case
    1076             :    * aFrame must be a "display root" (root frame for a root document,
    1077             :    * or the root of a popup) with an associated widget and we draw using
    1078             :    * the layer manager for the frame's widget.
    1079             :    * @param aDirtyRegion the region that must be painted, in the coordinates
    1080             :    * of aFrame.
    1081             :    * @param aBackstop paint the dirty area with this color before drawing
    1082             :    * the actual content; pass NS_RGBA(0,0,0,0) to draw no background.
    1083             :    * @param aBuilderMode Passed through to the display-list builder.
    1084             :    * @param aFlags if PAINT_IN_TRANSFORM is set, then we assume
    1085             :    * this is inside a transform or SVG foreignObject. If
    1086             :    * PAINT_SYNC_DECODE_IMAGES is set, we force synchronous decode on all
    1087             :    * images. If PAINT_WIDGET_LAYERS is set, aFrame must be a display root,
    1088             :    * and we will use the frame's widget's layer manager to paint
    1089             :    * even if aRenderingContext is non-null. This is useful if you want
    1090             :    * to force rendering to use the widget's layer manager for testing
    1091             :    * or speed. PAINT_WIDGET_LAYERS must be set if aRenderingContext is null.
    1092             :    * If PAINT_DOCUMENT_RELATIVE is used, the visible region is interpreted
    1093             :    * as being relative to the document (normally it's relative to the CSS
    1094             :    * viewport) and the document is painted as if no scrolling has occured.
    1095             :    * Only considered if nsIPresShell::IgnoringViewportScrolling is true.
    1096             :    * PAINT_TO_WINDOW sets painting to window to true on the display list
    1097             :    * builder even if we can't tell that we are painting to the window.
    1098             :    * If PAINT_EXISTING_TRANSACTION is set, then BeginTransaction() has already
    1099             :    * been called on aFrame's widget's layer manager and should not be
    1100             :    * called again.
    1101             :    * If PAINT_COMPRESSED is set, the FrameLayerBuilder should be set to
    1102             :    * compressed mode to avoid short cut optimizations.
    1103             :    *
    1104             :    * So there are three possible behaviours:
    1105             :    * 1) PAINT_WIDGET_LAYERS is set and aRenderingContext is null; we paint
    1106             :    * by calling BeginTransaction on the widget's layer manager.
    1107             :    * 2) PAINT_WIDGET_LAYERS is set and aRenderingContext is non-null; we
    1108             :    * paint by calling BeginTransactionWithTarget on the widget's layer
    1109             :    * manager.
    1110             :    * 3) PAINT_WIDGET_LAYERS is not set and aRenderingContext is non-null;
    1111             :    * we paint by construct a BasicLayerManager and calling
    1112             :    * BeginTransactionWithTarget on it. This is desirable if we're doing
    1113             :    * something like drawWindow in a mode where what gets rendered doesn't
    1114             :    * necessarily correspond to what's visible in the window; we don't
    1115             :    * want to mess up the widget's layer tree.
    1116             :    */
    1117             :   static nsresult PaintFrame(nsRenderingContext* aRenderingContext, nsIFrame* aFrame,
    1118             :                              const nsRegion& aDirtyRegion, nscolor aBackstop,
    1119             :                              nsDisplayListBuilderMode aBuilderMode,
    1120             :                              PaintFrameFlags aFlags = PaintFrameFlags(0));

    1427             :   /**
    1428             :    * Get the definite size contribution of aFrame for the given physical axis.
    1429             :    * This considers the child's 'min-width' property (or 'min-height' if the
    1430             :    * given axis is vertical), and its padding, border, and margin in the
    1431             :    * corresponding dimension.  If the 'min-' property is 'auto' (and 'overflow'
    1432             :    * is 'visible') and the corresponding 'width'/'height' is definite it returns
    1433             :    * the "specified size" for:
    1434             :    * https://drafts.csswg.org/css-grid/#min-size-auto
    1435             :    * Note that the "transferred size" is not handled here; use IntrinsicForAxis.

    1437             :    * If the 'min-' property is 'auto' and 'overflow' is not 'visible', then it
    1438             :    * calculates the result as if the 'min-' computed value is zero.
    1439             :    * Otherwise, return NS_UNCONSTRAINEDSIZE.

    1441             :    * @note this behavior is specific to Grid/Flexbox (currently) so aFrame
    1442             :    * should be a grid/flex item.

    2963             : nsLayoutUtils::PointIsCloserToRect(PointType aPoint, const RectType& aRect,

    2965             :                                    CoordType& aClosestYDistance)

    2968             :   CoordType fromRight = aPoint.x - aRect.XMost();
    2969             : 
    2970             :   CoordType xDistance;
    2971             :   if (fromLeft >= 0 && fromRight <= 0) {
    2972             :     xDistance = 0;
    2973             :   } else {
    2974             :     xDistance = std::min(abs(fromLeft), abs(fromRight));
    2975             :   }
    2976             : 
    2977             :   if (xDistance <= aClosestXDistance) {
    2978             :     if (xDistance < aClosestXDistance) {
    2979             :       aClosestYDistance = std::numeric_limits<CoordType>::max();
    2980             :     }
    2981             :

    2983             :     CoordType fromBottom = aPoint.y - aRect.YMost();
    2984             : 
    2985             :     CoordType yDistance;
    2986             :     if (fromTop >= 0 && fromBottom <= 0) {
    2987             :       yDistance = 0;
    2988             :     } else {
    2989             :       yDistance = std::min(abs(fromTop), abs(fromBottom));
    2990             :     }
    2991             :

    2993             :       aClosestXDistance = xDistance;
    2994             :       aClosestYDistance = yDistance;
    2995             :       return true;
    2996             :     }
    2997             :   }
    2998             : 
    2999             :   return false;
